label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Leo Wallerstein

label: Description
value: The figure of Venus is seen in profile, moving to the left. She carries an arrow in her right hand; a flaming heart in her left hand. She is accompanied by Taurus (the bull). At upper right the word "VENUS" and at upper left the symbol for copper.

label: Description
value: The figure of Mercury is seen moving to the left, his head turned toward the viewer. His left hand rests on his hip; his staff is held in his right hand. He is accompanied by Virgo (the Virgin) and Gemini (the twins). At upper right, the word "MERCURIUS," and the symbol for quick-silver (mercury).

label: Description
value: Panel of white silk, embroidered in silks in shades of rose, green, yellow, violet, blue, tan. Design, only part of which is present, shows an arch, crowned with flowers, fruit. to right a dog; below, right, buildings, branch of flowers. Rocky knoll with spring.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk on silk Technique: stem and satin stitch embroidery on plain weave faced with floats of a supplementary warp (full width)

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from the Mary Hearn Greims Fund

label: Description
value: Wide border embroidered with naturalistig flowering vine tied with bow knots, in soft shades of blue, green, tan, and red. Below, a border of Greek keys, scrolls and sprigs of flowers. Areas of drawnwork, chain and buttonhole stitches.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen embroidery on cotton foundation Technique: embroidered with drawnwork and chain stiches on plain weave

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from the Mary Hearn Greims Fund

label: Description
value: Short straight jacket with long straight set-in sleeves in pink silk lined with undyed glazed cotton and quilted in a fine allover zigzag pattern. Border of looser puffier zigzags on neck, front, hem, and sleeve edges.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Matthew A. Callender in memory of his wife, Rose M. A. Callender

label: Description
value: Male figure in long skirt, naked to the waist. Pink face with black moustache and beard; gold, black, red green and cream head-dress. Arms with articulated elbow. All flesh except face painted in gold. Green band at waist.

label: Physical description
value: Carved and painted wood, batik textile

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. Morris Ernst; 1950: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Man's night cap of white linen, made in four tapering sections, ornamented with embroidery in drawn fabric stitches in designs of conventionalized flowers.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen foundation, cotton embroidery Technique: buttonhole, chain, satin and stem stitch embroidery on plain weave; deflected element work with overcasting and cross stitch

label: Description
value: Hexagonal motif enclosing rosettes. Blue, red and green on tan ground.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: plain compound twill, brocaded

label: Description
value: Solidly worked multicolored pillow cover with a conventionalized fruit and flower border that encloses a scene from the Parable of the Prodigal Son; scene depicted is the time of his departure from his family with a bag containing his inheritance money.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool on linen, silk backing Technique: counted stitch embroidery

label: Description
value: Solidly worked multicolored pillow cover with a conventionalized fruit and flower border that encloses a scene from the Parable of the Prodigal Son; scene depicted is his return to his family as destitute, desperate and begging to return as a servant.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool on linen, silk backing Technique: counted stitch embroidery

value: Fragment of lace with green and red silk and silver gilt thread.

value: Medium: silk dyed blue, silver metallic foil wound onto white silk Technique: bobbin lace, metallic

label: Description
value: Oblong panel of linen embroidered in red silk. The background is solidly worked leaving the design in linen. Figures of people move in various scenes among trees. Figures and foliage are naturalistically rendered and are outlined in single running stitch. Background is in cross stitch. The scenes are probably biblical in origin, and the center group represents Saul hurling a spear at David who plays on his harp.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen, silk Technique: single running and cross stitch embroidery

value: The body of Christ is seen in the foreground supported by St. John. The Virgin  kneels and holds His hand. Landscape background.

label: Description
value: Christ is seated, at right, wearing a crown of thorns. A man kneels before Him. Four lines of printed text above (the title). Eight lines below and thirty on verso.

label: Description
value: Portrait of Holy Roman Emperor Maximilian I with an ornamental border by Hans Weiditz.

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Leo Wallerstein

label: Description
value: Pictured to the left of Siege of a City (Part 2), Part 1 depicts the city on the left with a prominent citadel and encircled by a wall. The landscape is dotted with vegetation and other buildings on fire. The attacking army surrounds the wall.

label: Description
value: Pictured to the right of Siege of a City (Part 1), Part 2 depicts army battalions marching towards the city. In the background, a fire engulfs the vegation and buildings.

label: Description
value: This pieta is modeled on the style of Dürer's engravings from the 1520s.

label: Provenance
value: From the Collection of Leo Wallerstein

label: Description
value: At right the body of Pyramus is on the ground, and at left stands Thisbe, throwing herself on her sword.  A fountain is seen in the background at right.
